text: Louise Leakey (born 21 March 1972) is a Kenyan paleontologist. She does research and field work on human fossils in East Africa.Mitchell, Ryan 2003. Anthropologist Louise Leakey carries "family banner". Louise started finding fossils in 1977. She was six years old. She is the youngest person to find hominid fossils. In 1993, she replaced her father Richard Leakey as field expedition leader for Turkana paleontological expeditions in one of the most arid and hostile environments on Earth. Today, together with her mother, Meave Leakey, she leads the Koobi Fora research project. The project has found some of the most important hominid fossils of the past two decades. The most recent is Kenyanthropus platyops. Louise Leakey was born in Kenya in 1972, the same year as her grandfather Louis Leakey died. She married Emmanuel de Merode, a Belgian primatologist in 2003. They have two daughters: Seiya, born in 2004, and Alexia born in 2006. == Family tree == ==Related pages== * List of Kenyan scientists ==References== ==Other websites== * Koobi Fora Research Project * Leakey Foundation * TED Talks: Louise Leakey digs for humanity's origins at TED in 2008 Category:1972 births Category:Kenyan scientists Category:Living people Category:British anthropologists Category:British palaeontologists Category:Leakey family Category:Anthropologists
title: Louise Leakey
